sentence.Network_en: There was no barrier between his eyes and hers now, no baffling remoteness.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在他们的两双眼睛之间毫无隔阂, 毫无疏远困惑的迹象了.

sentence.Network_en: He was usually preposterous vet somehow achieved a certain dignity by his remoteness and agelessness.
sentence.Network_cn: 他自己虽常常很荒谬,然而他以他表现出来的冷漠和无情赢得了一定的尊重.

entry.def: Remote areas are far away from cities and places where most people live, and are therefore difficult to get to.

example.ex: Landslides have cut off many villages in remote areas.
example.tran: 滑坡使边远地区的许多村庄与外界隔绝。

example.ex: ...a remote farm in the Yorkshire dales.
example.tran: 位于约克郡山谷的一个偏僻的农场

entry.def: The remote past or remote future is a time that is many years distant from the present.

example.ex: Slabs of rock had slipped sideways in the remote past, and formed this hole.
example.tran: 在久远的过去，岩石板滑落到周边，从而形成了这个洞。

entry.tran: 关系不紧密的;关系疏远的;相距甚远的
entry.def: If something is remote from a particular subject or area of experience, it is not relevant to it because it is very different.

example.ex: This government depends on the wishes of a few who are remote from the people...
example.tran: 这个政府按照远离民众的少数人的意愿行事。

example.ex: Teenagers are forced to study subjects that seem remote from their daily lives.
example.tran: 青少年被迫学习和他们的日常生活关系不大的学科。

entry.tran: (可能性或机会)渺茫的，微乎其微的
entry.def: If you say that there is a remote possibility or chance that something will happen, you are emphasizing that there is only a very small chance that it will happen.

example.ex: I use a sunscreen whenever there is even a remote possibility that I will be in the sun...
example.tran: 不论何时只要有一点可能暴露在阳光下，我就会用防晒霜。

example.ex: The chances of his surviving are pretty remote.
example.tran: 他生还的机会非常渺茫。

entry.tran: 冷漠的;冷淡的;与人疏远的;清高的
entry.def: If you describe someone as remote, you mean that they behave as if they do not want to be friendly or closely involved with other people.

example.ex: She looked so beautiful, and at the same time so remote.
example.tran: 她相貌如此美丽，同时又如此清高不群。

means.word_mean: 2. a disposition to be distant and unsympathetic in manner

auth_sentence.content: Sport dehumanises with its increasing remoteness from common experience.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sport dehumanises with its increasing remoteness from common experience.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sport dehumanises with its increasing remoteness from common experience.

auth_sentence.content: I love the remoteness, and I rather like reindeer.
auth_sentence.res_content: I love the remoteness, and I rather like reindeer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I love the remoteness, and I rather like reindeer.

auth_sentence.content: Cheap land and remoteness seem to have been its selling points.
auth_sentence.res_content: Cheap land and remoteness seem to have been its selling points.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Cheap land and remoteness seem to have been its selling points.
